data.title: Weather in Leipzig in July
data.meta_description: Discover the average weather, temperature and general climate of Leipzig in july. Find cheap flights in july and plan your trip to Leipzig on Avionero
data.text:
The expected average maximum temperature in July is +79°F with a maximum of +99°F and a minimum of +54°F.

The average maximum temperature goes down 12% by the end of the month, compared with the beginning of the month, from +77°F to +72°F.

Leipzig is typically warm in July.

Maximum temperatures go up compared to the previous month from +72°F to +75°F. The minimum temperature also goes up from +54°F to +57°F.

It’s generally warm, but pack a long-sleeve shirt for evenings.

July is one of the warmest months in Leipzig, here is the comparison with other months:

July weather is still as good as in June. It’s getting warmer as July arrives. The average maximum temperature goes up from +72°F to +75°F during the day. Prepare for more rain. Average rainfall goes from 66 mm to 73 mm. It feels drier, as humidity decreases from 69% to 67%. The average wind speed doesn’t change much during July, staying around 2 m/s. The good news is there are likely to be more sunny days in July, from 5 to 7.

August brings much the same weather, it remains good.

The average wind speed is 4 m/s getting up to 7 m/s which is a medium breeze. You can feel it, especially getting out of the water.

The average wind speed in Leipzig is gradually increasing during July, going from 5 m/s to 7 m/s over the course of the month.

The climate in Leipzig in July has not changed that much over the last 43 years.

The average temperature was the lowest in 1996 (+52°F) and the highest in 2019 (+61°F). The driest year was 2018 with only 357 mm of rainfall, and the wettest year was 2021 with 1744 mm.

For this page, we’ve looked at the typical weather in Leipzig, based on historical hourly weather data from January 1, 1979, to December 31, 2022.

For past dates, we show actual recorded data at the location at that time. Forecasts are based on recorded weather during that day of the year, averaged over the total years for which we have records (unless stated otherwise). The daily temperature is the highest recorded temperature in the shadow during that day.
